channel.title: Featured Projects on Harry Ingham - Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content in Featured Projects on Harry Ingham - Portfolio

item.title: Operation Exodus
item.description:
Operation Exodus is an Abertay University project for module DES310 with the brief “One More Run” suggested by Modern Wolf.

Abandoning their ruined and infected planet Hydrox, the last remaining Hydroxan population fights to survive by escaping on a large Colonist ship.

With the assistance of a coalition of a few other races they set out to find a new planet away from the dangers of the symbiote infection.

Unfortunately, the symbiote developed enough intelligence from its time on the planet to find a way to sneak aboard the ship, eventually taking over and infecting most of the inhabitants.

You are one of the last survivors, along with the other survivors in your hideout you struggle and strive to survive in this toxic environment. Made even more dangerous by the fact you cannot breathe the air and must rely on a dwindling stock of oxygen tanks to live.

It is your job to go out and scavenge for supplies as you await rescue or the inevitable end.

My main responsibilities in this project were to create the weapon and item systems, along with the supply shop, upgrade shop, and item storage. This involved the creation of pipelines to allow designers to implement new items using a scriptable object system, along with a fully modular system for implementing weapon functionalities.

I also implemented functionality for item pickups, along with the loot crates and enemy drops that would create them. In addition I implemented hotkey functionality to allow the player to bind useful items to a hotkey so that they can use them quickly in a pinch.

I was also put in charge of programming almost all on-screen UI elements, including indicators for health, oxygen and weapon heat, alongside interactive UI for the item and upgrade shops, and also with the item storage box and associated interactions with the inventory.

Creation of and handling of bug reports was also one of my major responsibilities on this project, with me being in charge of ensuring builds were stable and bug-free before showcases, and implementing feedback received during showcases of the game in order to create more enjoyable experiences. I was also responsible for compiling builds for both PC and Xbox One before showcases and ensuring there were no bugs introduced between development and release builds.

Operation Exodus was my first project developed in the Unity Engine, and was programmed in C#. We also took this project to Abertay University’s Dare Academy 2024, where we reached the semi-final stage.

Operation Exodus - Itch.io

Operation Exodus - Github

item.title: Vanishing Act
item.description:
Playing as a witch stuck in your mansion as it is being raided by a demonic entity, gather the ingredients to perform a ritual to escape. Made by myself and a few friends for the AGDS Freshers Jam 2024.

I developed the event-based interaction and highlight system for interacting with the various puzzle elements of the game. I was also responsible for creating the character controller and ensuring the camera provides an adequate view of the scene without clipping through any walls.

I was also responsible for creating the quest system used to track the player’s progress in the ritual, ensuring the player had to perform the ritual steps in the correct order, and updating the displayed elements on the ritual table as appropriate.

Vanishing Act was my first project developed in Unreal Engine, and was programmed in C++.

Vanishing Act - Itch.io

Vanishing Act - Github

item.title: Station Sentinels
item.description:
Station Sentinels is a top down shooter set in randomly generated levels upon a space station crawling with evil robots.

Shoot guns and throw weapons to progress through the three floors of the main mode, or try your hand at setting a local high score in the infinite arcade mode.

My main contribution to this project was the weapon system, including the programming of all weapon functionality, being able to throw weapons, handling of bullet logic and explosion logic for rockets.

I also created the arcade mode for the game, along with difficulty settings, allowing for greater replayability and ways for players to challenge themselves further.

In addition, I was responsible for optimising the memory usage of the game by improving model loading along with fixing issues with the procedural level generation to make levels generate much faster and ensure that all generated rooms are connected to each other.

Station Sentinels was created using Abertay University’s Games Education Framework, programmed in C++ and using Box2D to handle physics and collisions.

Station Sentinels - Itch.io

item.title: MasqueRAID
item.description:
Sneak in to the Museum of Masks to steal the GOLDEN MASK by utilising the masks on display to gain new abilities and evade detection by the museum’s security systems.

I was responsible for programming the various abilities of the mask, including teleportation, cloning the player, and allowing them to double jump.

I also created the tooltips that display the current mask’s controls to the player, helping them to quickly figure out their new abilities.

MasqueRAID was created in the Unity Engine, and was programmed in C#.

MasqueRAID - Global Game Jam

MasqueRAID - Github

item.title: Fishyphus
item.description:
A small game made by myself and a few friends for the 2 day long AGDS Halloween Jam 2024 made in the Unreal 5 Engine. Playing as the witch from Vanishing Act, and having successfully escaped the feds to your lakeside retreat, you are now on an eternal fishing holiday. My main contributions to this project were the bobbing of the fishing bobber, and the logic for when the player can catch a fish.

Since the mechanics of the game were quite simple, we were able to spend a lot of time coming up with the various junk items the player could fish up and fill their cauldron with. It was a fun opportunity to put a lot of inside jokes from our friend group, along with references to popular memes of the time, into a game in such a way that would only be entertaining to ourselves.

Fishyphus was created in Unreal Engine 5, and programmed using C++ and Unreal Blueprint Visual Scripting.

Fishyphus - Itch.io

Fishyphus - Github

item.title: Bubble Bunny Bout
item.description:
An extremely realistic depiction of two bunnies made of bubbles having a bout! A 2-player party game where you and your friend must duel to the death as bunnies made of bubbles using your controller joysticks to control your sword and shield arms.

I was responsible for handling the way points are awarded, along with scene transitions and the creation of the victory screen.

Bubble Bunny Bout was a group project created in 48 hours as part of Global Game Jam 2025 and was programmed in C++ using Unreal Engine.

Bubble Bunny Bout - Global Game Jam Page

Bubble Bunny Bout - Github
